document_reference.name: He created his own security firm
document_reference.excerpt: After some years as a very successful security consultant, he joined forces with former Legion of Doom member Dave Buchwald and a third colleague, Andrew Brown, to create the security consulting firm Crossbar Security.

document_reference.name: Lecturer
document_reference.excerpt: (...) lecturing on the history of telecommunications technology at the night courses of several New York City universities.

document_reference.name: Keynote speaker
document_reference.excerpt: He has been chosen as a keynote speaker at both hacker and security industry conferences worldwide and frequently visits universities to speak to students concerning information security.

document_reference.name: Subject to home search
document_reference.excerpt: On January 24, 1990, Abene and other MOD members had their homes searched and property seized by the U.S. Secret Service largely based on government suspicions of having caused ATandT's network crash just over a week earlier on January 15 (Abene was personally accused by the Secret Service of having done as much, during the search and seizure).

document_reference.name: Indicted of computer tampering and computer trepass
document_reference.excerpt: In February 1991, Abene was arrested and charged with computer tampering and computer trespass

document_reference.name: Sentenced to 35 hours of community service
document_reference.excerpt: Abene, who was a minor at the time, pleaded "not guilty" to the first two offenses and ultimately accepted a plea agreement to a lesser misdemeanor charge, and was sentenced to 35 hours of community service.

document_reference.name: Arrested with other members of the MOD
document_reference.excerpt: Abene and four other members of the Masters of Deception were also arrested in December 1991 and indicted by a Manhattan federal grand jury on July 8, 1992 on an 11-count charge.

document_reference.name: Sentenced to 12 months imprisonment
document_reference.excerpt: Despite the fact that Abene was a minor at the time the crimes were allegedly committed, was only involved in a small fraction of the sub-charges, and often in a passive way, a plea arrangement resulted in by far the harshest sentence: 12 months imprisonment, three years probation and 600 hours of community service.

document_reference.name: Served the sentence at a federal prison
document_reference.excerpt: After serving the one-year sentence at the Federal Prison "Camp" in Schuylkill, Pennsylvania, Abene was released in November 1994.

document_reference.name: Forgetful of danger signs
document_reference.excerpt: it really didn't sway me from doing what I was doing. Although in retrospect, I could have been more careful at that point.

document_reference.name: Lack of notion of illegal behaviour
document_reference.excerpt: There was no real notion you were doing something illegal. It really wasn't (illegal). The fact that you were using a guest account on a minicomputer being maintained at a high school ... there wasn't any notion that anyone was doing anything wrong.

document_reference.name: There were no clear-cut computer crime laws
document_reference.excerpt: And when I first got online there were no clear-cut computer crime laws.

document_reference.name: He was known as the Robin Hood of cyberspace
document_reference.excerpt: In Time, Joshua Quittner called him "the first underground hero of the Information Age, the Robin Hood of cyberspace."

document_reference.name: He defends the morals and motivations of hackers
document_reference.excerpt: Abene had built up a significant reputation in the hacker sub-culture, for example regularly appearing on the radio show Off the Hook, hosted by Eric Corley (a.k.a. Emmanuel Goldstein), debating and defending the morals and motivations of hackers in public forums and in interviews

document_reference.name: Observe a code of behavior
document_reference.excerpt: We always conducted our activities according to a certain code of behavior

document_reference.name: Proud of his past
document_reference.excerpt: I took part in something that at least I considered special. There were certainly some negative aspects in it in the trouble I got into. But there was definitely a lot of positive that came out of it.

document_reference.name: He was not really thinking about what the law says
document_reference.excerpt: When you are a young teenager you're not really thinking about what the law says.

document_reference.name: Unregretful of law violations
document_reference.excerpt: But it hasn't hindered your career at all, has it? Abene: Not at all. I've worked as a system administrator and network administrator. Even when I was still doing things that could obviously be construed as being illegal I did a fair amount of public speaking.

document_reference.name: Fearful of jail
document_reference.excerpt: What were you charged with and how much time did you serve? (...) It was not an experience I like thinking about and it is something I put behind me long since.

document_reference.name: He used his computer to access BBSes
document_reference.excerpt: After receiving the gifts of a RAM upgrade (to 20K) and a 300 baud modem from his parents, he used his computer to access CompuServe and shortly after discovered the world of dialup BBSes via people he met on CompuServe's "CB simulator", the first nation-wide online chat.

document_reference.name: He is intrigued by more powerful programming environment
document_reference.excerpt: Accessing those DEC minicomputers he realized there was a programming environment that was much more powerful than that of his own home computer

document_reference.name: He learns new programming languages
document_reference.excerpt: he began taking books out of the library in order to learn the programming languages that were now available to him.

document_reference.name: He views his computer as a window into a larger world
document_reference.excerpt: He realized there was a programming environment that was much more powerful than that of his own home computer, this and the ability to remotely save and load back programs that would still be there the next time he logged in had a profound effect on Abene, who came to view his rather simple computer as a window into a much larger world.

document_reference.name: Access to more powerful computers
document_reference.excerpt: One of our major motivations was that we wanted to get access to computers that were more powerful than the simplistic ones we had at home. Today most kids' home computers are a lot more powerful. For us it was a great equalizer. We wanted to get access to the high technology we otherwise wouldn't have access to, understand it, and learn to program it.

document_reference.name: Interested in telco system internals
document_reference.excerpt: Having learned about programming and fundamental security concepts during those early years, Abene further honed his skill in understanding the intricacies of the nation-wide telephone network.

document_reference.name: Explore the online frontier
document_reference.excerpt: Mark Abene first started using computers when he was about 9 years old, and by 12 he was exploring the electronic frontier from his home in Queens, New York.

document_reference.name: He is a computer security hacker
document_reference.excerpt: Mark Abene (born 1972), better known by his pseudonym Phiber Optik, is a computer security hacker

document_reference.name: He was member of hacker groups
document_reference.excerpt: Phiber Optik was once a member of the hacker groups Legion of Doom and Masters of Deception.

document_reference.name: On BBSes he found data to access to DEC minicomputers
document_reference.excerpt: On some of these BBSes, Abene discovered dialups and guest accounts to DEC minicomputers running the RSTS/E and TOPS-10 operating systems as part of the BOCES educational program in Long Island, New York.

document_reference.name: The focus of the group was to explore and understand technolody
document_reference.excerpt: Their main focus was to explore telecommunications systems, minicomputer and mainframe operating systems and large-scale packet data networks.

document_reference.name: He had built up a significant reputation in the hacker sub-culture
document_reference.excerpt: Abene had built up a significant reputation in the hacker sub-culture

document_reference.name: He wants to trade programming ideas and software
document_reference.excerpt: And I was seeking out people to trade programming ideas, possibly software and so on.

document_reference.name: Interested in underground topics
document_reference.excerpt: Behind the scenes there were often private sections restricted to specific users to discuss certain underground topics, not the least of which was trading passwords for online systems and even calling card numbers to circumvent toll charges.

document_reference.name: He shares the desire to understand technology
document_reference.excerpt: In the mid-1980s he was first introduced to members of the Legion of Doom (LOD), a loosely-knit group of highly respected teenage hackers who shared Abene's uncompromising desire to understand technology.

document_reference.name: Intellectual challenge
document_reference.excerpt: Besides being fun it was definitely an intellectual challenge.

document_reference.name: He was a high-profile hacker
document_reference.excerpt: Phiber Optik was a high-profile hacker in the early 1990s, appearing in The New York Times, Harper's, Esquire, in debates and on television.

document_reference.name: Eminent clientele
document_reference.excerpt: Abene's clientele come from various sectors of the corporate world, ranging from the financial and telecom industries to health care and high-technology. American Express, Sun Microsystems, IBM and Union Bank of Switzerland are a few of his former clients.

document_reference.name: Staff consultant
document_reference.excerpt: He has also worked as a staff consultant for Ernst and Young in their New York Information Security and Audit Services (ISAAS) group where he was recruited to help form Ernst and Young's Tiger Team practice.

document_reference.name: Knowledge of system administration and security models
document_reference.excerpt: I had gotten pretty proficient not only at programming, but at understanding the system administration and security models of a lot of these operating systems from DEC.

document_reference.name: He learned C to crack the login program
document_reference.excerpt: Another thing that motivated me to learn C was to be able to do modifications to the security infrastructure of a lot of these systems in order to maintain access to them...The log-in program that runs on Unix was written in C. Being able to modify that and insert a backdoor password for easy entry is something you had to be skilled to do.

document_reference.name: He learned C to run password crakers
document_reference.excerpt: And my motivation for wanting to program in C stemmed from my wanting to run password crackers.

document_reference.name: He wrote encryption routines for a streaming service
document_reference.excerpt: A fun job I had recently was writing the encryption routines for the online streaming service for Major League Baseball.

document_reference.name: Computer early adopter
document_reference.excerpt: Mark Abene's first contact with computers was at around 9 years of age at a local department store, where he would often pass the time while his parents shopped.

document_reference.name: His first computer was a TRS-80 MC-10
document_reference.excerpt: His first computer was a TRS-80 MC-10 with 4K of RAM, a 32-column screen, no lower case, and a cassette tape recorder to load and save programs.

document_reference.name: BBS employee
document_reference.excerpt: At the time of the indictment he was working at MindVox, an early BBS/ISP founded by two New York LOD members, and subsequently at ECHO, also a multi-user BBS and early ISP.

document_reference.name: Expert in information and network security
document_reference.excerpt: Mark Abene has over 20 years of professional experience in the field of information and network security

document_reference.name: Over reliance in hacker rules
document_reference.excerpt: We always believed that as long as we adhered to that code of behavior we wouldn't show up on too many people's radar.

document_reference.name: Opponent underestimation
document_reference.excerpt: I figured that these guys were so far off in what they believed was going on

document_reference.name: Security pundit
document_reference.excerpt: Abene has spoken on the subject of security in many publications such as the New York Times, the Washington Post, the Wall Street Journal, and Time Magazine.

document_reference.name: Worldwide company
document_reference.excerpt: Crossbar provided consulting services for a number of large corporations during its lifetime, during which the principals conducted business in the U.S., Japan, Brazil, and Sweden.

document_reference.name: Successful independent consultant
document_reference.excerpt: Living in New York City today, Abene is a successful independent consultant for various organizations.
